data.question: What is the chemical formula for the unsubstituted aminodiboranate synthesized from NH3·BH3 and sodium in tetrahydrofuran?
What method was used to synthesize sodium N-ethylaminodiboranate from BH3·thf and EtNH2?
data.answer: The method involved adding EtNH2 dropwise to BH3·thf at 0 °C, then transferring the solution to a flask containing sodium cubes and heating to reflux.

data.question: How does the synthesis of Na(H3B−NMeH−BH3) differ when using MeNH2 compared to the synthesis of Na(H3B−NH2−BH3) using NH3·BH3?
data.answer: Na(H3B−NMeH−BH3) synthesis involves adding MeNH2 to BH3·thf and then reacting with sodium, whereas Na(H3B−NH2−BH3) synthesis involves reacting NH3·BH3 directly with sodium.

data.question: Is the statement 'The synthesis of Na(H3B−NH2−BH3) yields a white powder after washing with benzene and pentane' true?
What is the role of tetrahydrofuran in the synthesis of unsubstituted aminodiboranate and its N-alkyl analogs?
data.answer: Tetrahydrofuran acts as a solvent in the synthesis process.

data.question: Can the synthesis of Na(H3B−NHMe−BH3) be considered successful if NaBH4 is present as an impurity?
data.answer: Yes, but NaBH4-free Na(H3B−NHMe−BH3) can be obtained by extracting the solid with diethyl ether.

data.question: What is the significance of the shift in δ values in the 11B NMR spectra for different aminodiboranates?
data.answer: The shift in δ values indicates the deshielding effect caused by replacing NH groups with NMe groups, suggesting that all these salts are in the same chemical class.

data.question: Is the method of synthesizing Na(H3B−NHEt−BH3) by reacting EtNH2 with BH3·thf and sodium cubes at 0 °C and then heating to reflux unique to this compound?
What analytical technique was used to confirm the conversion of NH3·BH3 to NaNH2BH3 in the synthesis of Na(H3B−NH2−BH3)?
data.answer: 11B NMR spectroscopy was used to confirm the conversion.

data.question: How does the presence of NaBH4 as an impurity affect the purity of synthesized aminodiboranates?
data.answer: The presence of NaBH4 as an impurity reduces the purity of synthesized aminodiboranates, but it can be removed by extracting the solid with diethyl ether.

data.question: Is the synthesis of Na(H3B−NMeEt−BH3) similar to that of Na(H3B−NH2−BH3) in terms of the reactants used?
What is the yield percentage for the synthesis of Na(H3B−NH2−BH3) using method B?
Does the synthesis of Na(H3B−N(C4H8)−BH3) involve the use of pyrrolidine?
What is the common byproduct observed in the synthesis of all aminodiboranates?
data.answer: NaBH4 is typically observed as a byproduct in the synthesis of all aminodiboranates.

data.question: How does the synthesis of Na(H3B−N(C5H10)−BH3) compare to that of Na(H3B−N(C4H8)−BH3) in terms of reactants?
data.answer: The synthesis of both compounds involves similar procedures but uses different cyclic amines: pyrrolidine for Na(H3B−N(C4H8)−BH3) and piperidine for Na(H3B−N(C5H10)−BH3).

data.question: Is the use of sodium cubes a common step in the synthesis of unsubstituted aminodiboranate and its N-alkyl analogs?
What is the role of 1,4-dioxane in the synthesis of sodium N-methylaminodiboranate dioxane (1:0.5)?
data.answer: 1,4-Dioxane acts as a solvent to form the dioxane adduct of sodium N-methylaminodiboranate.

data.question: How does the synthesis of Er(H3B−NH2−BH3)Cl2(thf)3 demonstrate the use of Na(H3B−NH2−BH3) as a ligand for metal complexes?
data.answer: The synthesis involves treating ErCl3 with Na(H3B−NH2−BH3) in tetrahydrofuran, showcasing the use of Na(H3B−NH2−BH3) as a ligand to form a new erbium complex.

data.question: Is the formation of a white powder a common observation across the synthesis of various aminodiboranates?
What analytical techniques were employed to characterize the synthesized aminodiboranates?
data.answer: Elemental analysis, IR spectroscopy, 1H NMR, and 11B NMR spectroscopy were used for characterization.
